result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon E Pressley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 3 days only if revoked.

The Court has no objections to early release from probation as long as all conditions are succesesfully completed but it is the ultimate decision of P&P.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant may not have any violent contact with the victim (N.R.) but is allowed contact for exchange of the children in common or issues with the children.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
As deemed appropriate by P&P.

Must be completetd within the first year of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1 except no additional fine or community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon E Pressley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:22 PM. State has complied with victim notification requirements with no response. Scholke - resolved - plead G to count #1 as alleged, #2 - DRI, #3 - amend to misd intimidation of a witness contrary to 940.42, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years  with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges on count #1, costs on count #2, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, restitiution if requested (none requested), no possession of alcohol, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no contact with victim (does share children with the victim so asks for contact to be allowed for visitation of the children). State and Pressley agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and amends count #2 to misd intimidation of witness contrary to 940.42. Pressley pleads G to count #1 as alleged and #3 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 3 days only if revoked. Pressley makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: count #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges (DA), count #2 - costs only, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, 100 hour of community service - to be performed within the first year of probation, no violent contact with victim (N.R.) and contact is allowed for exchange or issues involving the children in common, 3 days credit only if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, Court has no objections to early release from probation if all conditions are satisfied but up to P&P, right to appeal, adjourned.
by mail-notice of appearance and demand for discovery and inspection to DA C. Simono

Defendant Brandon E Pressley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:49 PM. Scholke hands court a waiver of PH form. Court goes over form and finds the defendant is freely and voluntairly waiving his right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Scholke has information and it mirrors, waives further reading, enters NG pleas and asks for FPT. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Brandon E Pressley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:31 AM. Chad Lynch appears specially for Michael Scholke. Pressley has complaint, Lynch has not gone over it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Pressley understands charges and penalties. Court continues bond, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
